problem.markdown:
>>Q1. The purpose of talking levels on each side of a main line at right angles to that line in order to determine a vertical cross-section of the surface of the ground, is known as<< ( ) Differential levelling ( ) Profile levelling (x) Cross-section ( ) Reciprocal levelling ( ) Precise levelling
>>Q2. A method of levelling in which the difference in elevation between two points is accurately determined by two sets of reciprocal observations when it is not possible to set up the level between the two points is known as<< ( ) Differential levelling ( ) Profile levelling ( ) Cross-section (x) Reciprocal levelling ( ) Precise levelling
>>Q4. A survey conducted along a narrow strip of territory for the location, design and construction of a canal, is known as<< () Hydraulic survey () Hydrographic survey () Topographic survey () Curve survey (x) Route survey
>>Q5. The angle of field of the telescope<< ( ) increases as the magnifying power increase ( ) increases as the distance between eye piece and object increases (x) increases as the size of the eye piece increases ( ) depends in the size of the object glas
>>Q6. A fixed point of reference of known elevation is known as<< (x) bench mark ( )datum ( ) change point ( ) station point
>>Q7. 'Cross-sectioning' and 'longitudinal sectioning' is usually involved in<< ( ) Check levelling ( ) Differential levelling ( ) Simple levelling (x) Profile leveling
>>Q8. Bench mark is established by<< ( ) spirit levelling ( ) hypsometry (x) trigonometrical levelling ( ) barometric levelling
>>Q9. The rise and fall method of reduction of levels provides a check<< (x) back sights only ( ) fore sights only ( ) intermediate sights only ( ) all the sights
>>Q10. The method of line of collimation of reduction of levels does not provide a check<< (x) on intermediate sights ( ) on fore sights ( ) on back sights ( ) on reduced levels of the points
>>Q11. During levelling if back sight is more than foresight, then foresight, then<<
(x) forward staff is lower than back staff point ( ) back staff point is lower than forward staff point ( ) difference in level cannot be ascertained ( ) none of the above is correct
>>Q12. The back staff reading on B.M. of reduced level 500.000 m is 2.685 m and the fore sight reading on B is 1.345 m, the reduced level of B, is<< ( ) 502.685 m ( ) 501.345 m (x) 501.340 m ( ) 504.030 m ( ) 502.585 m
>>Q13. While viewing through a level telescope and moving the eye slightly, a relative movement occurs between the image of the levelling staff and the cross hairs. The instrument is<< ( ) correctly focused ( ) not correctly focused ( ) said to have parallax (x) free from parallax
>>Q14. For the execution of highway (or railway) projects<< ( ) longitudinal sections are required ( ) cross sections are required ( ) both longitudinal and cross sections are required (x) none of the above
>>Q15. Pick up the correct statement from the following<< ( ) A level surface is perpendicular at all points to the direction of gravity ( ) A level line lies in a level surface ( ) A horizontal plane is normal to the direction of gravity at only one point ( ) A horizontal line is tangential to the level surface (x) All the above
>>Q16. The first staff reading after the level has been moved to a new position is<< ( ) Foresight ( ) intermediate sight ( ) back sight (x) any sight
>>Q17. In case of reduction of levels by heights of instrument method<< (x) B.S. - F.S. = Difference in R.L. of the first station and last station ( ) (R.L. + I + F.S) – first R.L.= (H.I.+NO. Of R.L.s.) ( ) both (a) and (b) ( ) neither (a) nor (b)
Q18. Removal of parallex, may be achieved by ( ) refocusing the objective (x) refocussing the eye – piece ( ) refocussing the objective and the eye- piece ( ) none of the above
